Detailed Description

a tool to access a block of memory as if it was a CDB the block of memory is described by a class or structure name the name must be registered using sinfo

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

does not work as copy constructor !

) [inline, virtual]

the structure cannot be modified so it will work as a Move

virtual void MMCDB::CleanUp ( CDBAddressMode  cdbam = CDBAM_FromRoot) [inline, virtual]

Cannot remove anything!!

CDBVirtual * MMCDB::Clone ( CDBCreationMode  cdbcm)

creates a new reference to a database, or if that is not possible it creates a copy

Parameters:
cdbcm= CDBCM_CopyAddress ensures that the new object points at the same location
virtual bool MMCDB::CopyFrom ( CDBVirtual *  cdbv) [inline, virtual]

Copy the pointed subtree in cdbv into the current subtree

bool MMCDB::CopyTo ( CDBVirtual *  cdbv) [inline]

Copy the pointed subtree in cdbv into the current subtree

virtual bool MMCDB::Delete ( const char *  configName) [inline, virtual]

remove an entry or subtree (position is relative!) to delete a link use the linkTo as the leaf name to delete a subtree simply specify the group node

virtual void MMCDB::EnableParserReports ( bool  flag) [inline, virtual]

enable reports of parser during ReadFromStream into err

bool MMCDB::Exists ( const char *  configName) [virtual]

whether a certain entry exists

virtual bool MMCDB::FindSubTree ( const char *  configName,
CDBAddressMode  cdbam = CDBAM_None 
) [inline, virtual]

from node search on the right of the tree for the subtree identified by the string name. On success nodes points to the node containing the subtree or leaf Will not follow links.

Parameters:
cdbam= CDBAM_SkipCurrent search in the current subtree excluding current node any other flag are NOT SUPPORTED
bool MMCDB::GetArrayDims ( int *  size,
int &  maxDim,
const char *  configName,
CDBArrayIndexingMode  cdbaim = CDBAIM_Flexible,
bool  caseSensitive = True 
) [virtual]

if cdbaim is CDBAIM_Strict, it expects all the indexes to be found form 0 to n-1 and the same number in all subtrees.

const char *  linkTo,

virtual bool MMCDB::LoadFromEnvironment ( char **  env) [inline, virtual]

load from environment or from any NULL terminated list of chars

virtual bool MMCDB::Lock ( ) [inline, virtual]

no need for locking!

bool MMCDB::Move ( const char *  subTreeName) [virtual]

move to the specified location. The movement is relative to the current location

bool MMCDB::MoveToBrother ( int  steps = 1) [virtual]

0 means remain where you are, > 0 brothers on the right < 0 on the left

bool MMCDB::MoveToChildren ( int  childNumber = 0) [virtual]

negative number move up. >=0 chooses the subtree, 0 is the first of the children

bool MMCDB::MoveToFather ( int  steps = 1) [virtual]

-1 = Root, one level up for each positive

bool MMCDB::MoveToRoot ( ) [inline]

moves back to the root

the name of the current node

bool MMCDB::NodeType ( BString &  name) [virtual]

the type of the current node

int MMCDB::NumberOfChildren ( ) [virtual]

how many branches from this node. Negative number implies that the location is a leaf

virtual int MMCDB::Size ( CDBAddressMode  cdbam) [inline, virtual]

The total number of nodes.

Parameters:
cdbamCDBAM_SubTreeOnly allows to measure the current subtree CDBAM_LeafsOnly allows counting only the data nodes
bool MMCDB::SubTreeName ( Streamable &  name,
const char *  sep = "." 
) [virtual]

finds the overall path leading to the current node

virtual bool MMCDB::TreeMove ( int  index,
CDBAddressMode  cdbam = CDBAM_LeafsOnly 
) [inline, virtual]

move to a location within the whole (sub)tree. The nodes are numbered from left to right and from subnode to supernode

Parameters:
cdbamif it contains CDBAM_LeafsOnly it will not account the group nodes if it contains CDBAM_SubTreeOnly addresses only the subtree if it contains CDBAM_Relative it is a step from current location and is assumed global If the node does not exist returns False and remains in the start position
virtual int MMCDB::TreePosition ( CDBAddressMode  cdbam = CDBAM_LeafsOnly) [inline, virtual]

in the left to right bottom to top order the absolute location of a node

Parameters:
cdbamCDBAM_LeafsOnly allows counting only the data nodes
